title: Articles
text:
Published articles

Marine protected areas modulate habitat suitability of the invasive round goby (Neogobius melanostomus) in the Baltic Sea
Stressor richness intensifies productivity loss but mitigates biodiversity loss

title: About
text:
About me



I recently finished my PhD at the University of Namur in the lab of Frederik de Laender and am now off to Bilbao to work with Daniel Montoya BC3.
I have worked on:

Modelling the habitat suitability of an invasive fish species in the Baltic Sea
Modelling the effects of stressors on competitive communities
Experiments on phytoplankton communities
Clustering of phytoplankton species using flow cytometry
Identification of phytoplankon in rivers with microscopy
Modelling the effects of trait evolution on community stability
Other stuff that I will put here when I am more organised and have a better plan about this website



Find my pubished articles here.
